sen.j: 京極 高長（きょうごく たかなが、元禄8年5月1日 (旧暦)（1695年6月12日）- 明和6年4月3日 (旧暦)（1769年5月8日））は、丹後国峰山藩の第5代藩主。
sen.e: Takanaga KYOGOKU (June 12, 1695 to 5 Aug 1769) was the 5th hereditary domain head of the Mineyama domain in Tango Province.
Takanaga KYOGOKU (June 12, 1695 to 5 Aug 1769) was the 5th hereditary domain head of the Mineyama domain in Tango Province.
Takanaga KYOGOKU (June 12, 1695 - August 5, 1769) was the fifth hereditary domain head of the Mineyama Domain in Tango Province.

sen.j: 陸奥国棚倉藩主（のち越後国村上藩主）内藤弌信の三男（四男との説もある）。
sen.e: Takanaga was the third son (some say 4th) of Kazunobu NAITO the lord of Tanagura Domain in Mutsu Province (and subsequently the lord of Murakami Domain in Echigo Province).
Takanaga was the third son (some say 4th) of Kazunobu NAITO the lord of Tanagura Domain in Mutsu Province (and subsequently the lord of Murakami Domain in Echigo Province).
Takanaga was the third son (some say forth) of Kazunobu NAITO the lord of Tanagura Domain in Mutsu Province (and subsequently the lord of Murakami Domain in Echigo Province).
His legal wife was the daughter of Kyogoku TAKAYUKI.
His legal wife was the daughter of Kyogoku TAKAYUKI.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Kyogoku TAKAYUKI.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、備後国守、主膳正。
sen.e: His court rank was Lower Junior Fifth Rank, Governor of Bingo Province and Shuzen no Kami (head of Shuzengen).
His court rank was Lower Junior Fifth Rank, Governor of Bingo Province and Shuzen no Kami (head of Shuzengen).
His court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Governor of Bingo Province and Shuzen no Kami (head of Shuzengen).

sen.j: 元禄8年（1695年）5月1日、陸奥国棚倉で生まれる。
sen.e: Takanaga was born in Tanagura, Mutsu Province in June 12, 1695.
Takanaga was born in Tanagura, Mutsu Province in June 12, 1695.
Takanaga was born in Tanagura, Mutsu Province in June 12, 1695.

sen.j: 正徳 (日本)4年（1714年）、先代藩主・高之の婿養子となった。
sen.e: In 1714 he became the adopted son-in-law of the previous domain lord, Takayuki KYOGOKU.
In 1714 he became the adopted son-in-law of the previous domain lord, Takayuki KYOGOKU.
In 1714 he became the adopted son-in-law of the previous domain lord, Takayuki KYOGOKU.

sen.j: 享保8年（1723年）、高之の死去で後を継ぐ。
sen.e: He succeeded Takayuki KYOGOKU when Takayuki died in 1723.
He succeeded Takayuki KYOGOKU when Takayuki died in 1723.
He succeeded Takayuki KYOGOKU when Takayuki died in 1723.

sen.j: 明和2年（1765年）8月8日、養嗣子の京極高久に家督を譲って隠居し、明和6年（1769年）4月3日に江戸で死去した。
sen.e: On 8 August 1765 he assigned his leadership of the domain to Takahisa KYOGOKU (his adopted heir) and retired; passing away in Edo on 5 Aug 1769.
On 8 August 1765 he assigned his leadership of the domain to Takahisa KYOGOKU (his adopted heir) and retired; passing away in Edo on 5 Aug 1769.
On September 22, 1765 he assigned his leadership of the domain to Takahisa KYOGOKU (his adopted heir) and retired; passing away in Edo on August 5, 1769.
Age at death: 75 years old.
Age at death: 75 years old.
He died at the age of 75.

sen.j: 法号：源寥院廓誉常光道仙。
sen.e: Posthumous Buddhist name: Genryoin Royo Joko Dosen
Posthumous Buddhist name: Genryoin Royo Joko Dosen
Posthumous Buddhist name: Genryoin Royo Joko Dosen

sen.j: 墓所：東京都江東区白河 (江東区)の道本山霊巌寺 (東京都江東区)。
sen.e: Gravesite: Dohonzan Regan-ji Temple in Shirakawa, Koto Ward, Tokyo
Gravesite: Dohonzan Regan-ji Temple in Shirakawa, Koto Ward, Tokyo
Gravesite: Dohonzan Regan-ji Temple in Shirakawa, Koto Ward, Tokyo

sen.j: 後に京都府京丹後市峰山町吉原の安泰山常立寺に改葬。
sen.e: He was subsequently reburied at Antaizan Joryu-ji Temple in Yoshiwara, Mineyama-cho, Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture.
He was subsequently reburied at Antaizan Joryu-ji Temple in Yoshiwara, Mineyama-cho, Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture.
He was subsequently reburied at Antaizan Joryu-ji Temple in Yoshiwara, Mineyama-cho, Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture.
